org.sd.nlp
Interface TokenPointer

All Known Implementing Classes:
DelimitedStringTokenPointer, LoStringWrapperTokenPointer, LslStringWrapperTokenPointer, SoStringWrapperTokenPointer, StringWrapperTokenPointer
public interface TokenPointer

Pointer to a token and accessor for related tokens.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Method Summary
 Categories getCategories()
          Get the referenced token's categories.
 java.lang.String getInputBeyond(java.lang.String unnormalizedInput)
          Get the full unnormalized input after the referenced token, using the unnormalized input string as reference if necessary.
 java.lang.String getInputThrough(java.lang.String unnormalizedInput)
          Get the full unnormalized input up through the referenced token, using the unnormalized input string as reference if necessary.
 int getPosition()
          Get the (start word) position of this token within its string.
 java.lang.String getString()
          Get the referenced token's string.
 boolean isGuessable()
          Determine whether this token pointer is guessable.
 TokenPointer next(boolean allowSkip)
          Get the next token pointer that immediately follows this one.
 TokenPointer revise()
          Get another token pointer based on shortening or lengthening the referenced token's size.
 

Method Detail

getString

java.lang.String getString()
Get the referenced token's string.

getCategories

Categories getCategories()
Get the referenced token's categories.

getPosition

int getPosition()
Get the (start word) position of this token within its string.

revise

TokenPointer revise()
Get another token pointer based on shortening or lengthening the referenced token's size. This revision strategy must be correlated with the "next" strategy.

next

TokenPointer next(boolean allowSkip)
Get the next token pointer that immediately follows this one. The strategy for building the next token (longest, shortest, etc.) must be correlated with the "revise" strategy.

Parameters:
allowSkip - if true, allow skipping text within limits established on construction; otherwise, don't skip.

getInputThrough

java.lang.String getInputThrough(java.lang.String unnormalizedInput)
Get the full unnormalized input up through the referenced token, using the unnormalized input string as reference if necessary.

getInputBeyond

java.lang.String getInputBeyond(java.lang.String unnormalizedInput)
Get the full unnormalized input after the referenced token, using the unnormalized input string as reference if necessary.

isGuessable

boolean isGuessable()
Determine whether this token pointer is guessable.

Note that calling this method can have side-effects on the instance.
